nodes.bodyText: Could be moved to an instance variable to avoid getting the extension each time in getWebDriverImpl.
Needs to be removed on unload.
We should also handle/catch the Exception here.
IMO we should use a parameter object (or add a "utils" param) to allow to add more state/behaviour without breaking compatibility.

nodes.bodyText: Could link to Selenium JavaDoc/docs (to know about the WebDriver interface and other helpful classes, e.g. WebDriverWait).

@@ -10,8 +10,13 @@

Selenium

The Selenium add-on provides WebDrivers, for other add-ons, to invoke and remotely control web browsers. It's also bundled the HtmlUnit web browser, an headless Java based web browser. + +

It adds a 'Selenium' script type - these scripts are invoked whenever selenium launches a browser,

nodes.bodyText:
These scripts → The Selenium scripts?
Shouldn't we say this when describing the script type above? Also, should we be more generic? e.g. ...and can interact with it, for example, run JavaScript scripts, access URLs, fill forms, click buttons....
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -10,8 +10,13 @@

Selenium

The Selenium add-on provides WebDrivers, for other add-ons, to invoke and remotely control web browsers. It's also bundled the HtmlUnit web browser, an headless Java based web browser. + +

It adds a 'Selenium' script type - these scripts are invoked whenever selenium launches a browser, + for example for the Ajax Spider or for manual browsing. +

The add-on also adds a right click option to ZAP panels that list URLs (such at the History and Sites tree) - which allows you to open the selected URL in any of the supported browsers. + which allows you to open the selected URL in any of the supported browsers. These scripts have access to the + launched browser and can run JavaScript commands on it.

@@ -0,0 +1,49 @@
+// This script will log a browser into Juice Shop when forced user mode is enabled.
+// The  'Juice Shop Session Management.js' script must have been set to authenticate correctly.

nodes.bodyText:
We should provide this behaviour with the parameter/utils object (e.g. utils.waitFor('http://example.org') or utils.waitForPageAccess()), this is expected to be used by most scripts.
This needs a timeout, otherwise it might lead to an infinite loop (cases in the following comment).
It needs to obtain the current URL inside the loop otherwise this will not work properly if the browser is started with about:blank or if the browser is closed before accessing any URL.
Worth adding JSDoc describing the parameters.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@

nodes.bodyText: Should the scripts be called for these browsers too?
